DataElement.preferredName: Person Breast Intervention or Procedure Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable for questions addressing the results of breast interventional activities that produce an effect, or intended to alter the course of disease that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects as outlined in the study protocol to allow a person to participate in the clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Breast Intervention or Procedure Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects._The result of an action._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Property.preferredName: Breast Intervention or Procedure Outcome Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:The result of an action.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 per Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reves

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient was treated by BCS
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient was treated by BCS or mastectomy and axillary dissection, patient has 1-3 positive axillary nodes (macrometastases, greater than 2 mm).
